citations.narrative:
The facility has not followed vaccination protocol outlined in the program of veterinary care. The facility has not
administered the rabies vaccine to a female miniature schnauzer microchip number 29715 and a female cavalier king
charles spaniel microchip number 29704 in accordance with the approved vaccination schedule. Failure to provide
vaccinations on a schedule approved by the attending veterinarian leads to an increase risk of contagious and/or deadly
diseases in the dogs. Correct by ensuring that vaccinations for contagious and/or deadly diseases in accordance with a
schedule approved by the attending veterinarian are implemented.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by 19-March-2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility has not followed vaccination protocol outlined in the program of veterinary care. The facility has not 
administered the rabies vaccine to a female miniature schnauzer microchip number 29715 and a female cavalier king 
charles spaniel microchip number 29704 in accordance with the approved vaccination schedule. Failure to provide 
vaccinations on a schedule approved by the attending veterinarian leads to an increase risk of contagious and/or deadly 
diseases in the dogs. Correct by ensuring that vaccinations for contagious and/or deadly diseases in accordance with a 
schedule approved by the attending veterinarian are implemented. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2  more inspections or by 19-March-2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.

n
